content: You're not obligated to win. You're obligated to keep trying to do the best you can every day.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

content: Just trust yourself, then you will know how to live.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Abraham Lincoln
content: No man has a good enough memory to be a successful liar.
The pain passes, but the beauty remains.
author: Pierre-Auguste Renoir

content: Wisdom is a kind of knowledge. It is knowledge of the nature, career, and consequences of human values.
author: Sidney Hook

content: The most precious gift we can offer anyone is our attention. When mindfulness embraces those we love, they will bloom like flowers.
author: Thích Nhất Hạnh

content: The trick is in what one emphasizes. We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves happy. The amount of work is the same.
author: Carlos Castaneda

content: It is not only for what we do that we are held responsible, but also for what we do not do.
author: Molière

content: Friendship with oneself is all important, because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else in the world.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

content: It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.
author: William Shakespeare

content: Never explain - your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.
author: Elbert Hubbard
Theodore Isaac Rubin
content: Happiness does not come from doing easy work but from the afterglow of satisfaction that comes after the achievement of a difficult task that demanded our best.
What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: To change one's life, start immediately, do it flamboyantly, no exceptions.
author: William James

content: Let yourself be silently drawn by the stronger pull of what you really love.
author: Rumi

content: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Laozi

content: The wise man does not lay up his own treasures. The more he gives to others, the more he has for his own.
author: Laozi

content: It is fatal to enter any war without the will to win it.
author: Douglas MacArthur

content: If you spend your whole life waiting for the storm, you'll never enjoy the sunshine.
author: Morris West

content: The sincere friends of this world are as ship lights in the stormiest of nights.
author: Giotto
Reggie Jackson (basketball, born 1990)
content: Fans don't boo nobodies.
We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.
author: Orson Welles

content: We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey.
author: Kenji Miyazawa

content: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
author: Nelson Mandela

content: Applause is a receipt, not a bill.
author: Dale Carnegie

content: The universe is transformation; our life is what our thoughts make it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Friends are those rare people who ask how we are and then wait to hear the answer.
author: Ed Cunningham

content: If there is no struggle, there is no progress.
author: Frederick Douglass

content: Knowledge is of no value unless you put it into practice.
author: Anton Chekhov

content: Accept challenges, so that you may feel the exhilaration of victory.
author: George S. Patton

content: A man is not old as long as he is seeking something.
author: Edmond Rostand

content: People may doubt what you say, but they will believe what you do.
author: Lewis Cass

content: The way is not in the sky. The way is in the heart.
author: Buddha

content: A thing well said will be wit in all languages.
author: John Dryden
Woodrow Wilson
content: Golf is a game in which one endeavors to control a ball with implements ill adapted for the purpose.
It is more shameful to distrust our friends than to be deceived by them.
author: Confucius

content: Change will not come if we wait for some other person or some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.
author: Barack Obama

content: It is better to have enough ideas for some of them to be wrong, than to be always right by having no ideas at all.
author: Edward de Bono

content: When an opponent comes forward, move in and greet him; if he wants to pull back, send him on his way.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

content: Man is not sum of what he has already, but rather the sum of what he does not yet have, of what he could have.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

content: It is difficult to achieve a spirit of genuine cooperation as long as people remain indifferent to the feelings and happiness of others.
author: Dalai Lama

content: Trust your own instinct. Your mistakes might as well be your own, instead of someone else's.
author: Billy Wilder
Barry Switzer
content: Some people are born on third base and go through life thinking they hit a triple.
It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.
author: Epictetus
John Kenneth Galbraith
content: Meetings are indispensable when you don't want to do anything.
Friendship is an arrangement by which we undertake to exchange small favors for big ones.
author: Montesquieu

content: It's important to know that words don't move mountains. Work, exacting work moves mountains.
author: Danilo Dolci

content: If you correct your mind, the rest of your life will fall into place.
author: Laozi
Howard H. Aiken
content: Don't worry about people stealing your ideas. If your ideas are any good, you'll have to ram them down people's throats.

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: How many legs does a dog have if you call his tail a leg? Four. Saying that a tail is a leg doesn't make it a leg.

author: Laurence J. Peter
content: An economist is an expert who will know tomorrow why the things he predicted yesterday didn't happen today.
If your actions inspire others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more, you are a leader.
author: John Quincy Adams

content: We should not judge people by their peak of excellence; but by the distance they have traveled from the point where they started.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

content: Life is a gift, and it offers us the privilege, opportunity, and responsibility to give something back by becoming more
author: Tony Robbins

content: But man is not made for defeat. A man can be destroyed but not defeated.
author: Ernest Hemingway
Abraham Lincoln
content: I am a firm believer in the people. If given the truth, they can be depended upon to meet any national crisis. The great point is to bring them the real facts.
In action a great heart is the chief qualification. In work, a great head.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

content: It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: The world makes way for the man who knows where he is going.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Your friends will know you better in the first minute you meet than your acquaintances will know you in a thousand years.
author: Richard Bach

content: Friendship is a very taxing and arduous form of leisure activity.
author: Mortimer J. Adler

content: I believe that we are solely responsible for our choices, and we have to accept the consequences of every deed, word, and thought throughout our lifetime.
author: Elisabeth Kübler-Ross

content: I think somehow, we learn who we really are and then live with that decision.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

content: If you love someone, set them free. If they come back, they're yours; if they don't, they never were.
author: Richard Bach
Winston Churchill
content: It is no use saying, 'We are doing our best.' You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary.
Everything you are against weakens you. Everything you are for empowers you.
author: Wayne Dyer

content: You can't stop the waves, but you can learn to surf.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

content: Sunshine is delicious, rain is refreshing, wind braces us up, snow is exhilarating; there is really no such thing as bad weather, only different kinds of good weather.
author: John Ruskin

content: Miracles come in moments. Be ready and willing.
author: Wayne Dyer

content: Nothing happens unless first we dream.
author: Carl Sandburg

content: True friends stab you in the front.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: Wisdom is oftentimes nearer when we stoop than when we soar.
author: William Wordsworth

content: If there is such a thing as a good marriage, it is because it resembles friendship rather than love.
author: Michel de Montaigne

content: If we are not given the chance to forget, we are also not given the chance to recover our memories, to alter them with time, perspective, and wisdom. Forgetting, we can be ourselves beyond what the past has told us we are; we can evolve. That is the possibility we want from the future.
author: Caterina Fake

content: All serious daring starts from within.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

content: Face your deficiencies and acknowledge them; but do not let them master you. Let them teach you patience, sweetness, insight.
author: Helen Keller

content: Take things as they are. Punch when you have to punch. Kick when you have to kick.
author: Bruce Lee

content: To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
author: Confucius

content: Science and technology revolutionize our lives, but memory, tradition and myth frame our response.
author: Arthur M. Schlesinger Jr.

content: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
author: Euripides

content: Do the one thing you think you cannot do. Fail at it. Try again. Do better the second time. The only people who never tumble are those who never mount the high wire. This is your moment. Own it.
author: Oprah Winfrey

content: The world cares very little about what a man or woman knows; it is what a man or woman is able to do that counts.
author: Booker T. Washington
Warren Bennis
content: Trust is the lubrication that makes it possible for organizations to work.
Problems are only opportunities with thorns on them.
author: Hugh Miller

content: The important thing is this: to be able at any moment to sacrifice what we are for what we could become.
author: Charles Du Bos

content: Where is the Life we have lost in living? Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge? Where is the knowledge we have lost in information?
author: George Eliot
Winston Churchill
content: The best argument against democracy is a five-minute conversation with the average voter.
You will not be punished for your anger; you will be punished by your anger.
author: Buddha

content: The highest stage in moral culture at which we can arrive is when we recognize that we ought to control our thoughts.
author: Charles Darwin
Alan Watts
content: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
Quality is never an accident; it is always the result of intelligent effort.
author: John Ruskin

content: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
author: Marcel Proust

content: Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.
author: Buddha

content: The person who makes a success of living is the one who see his goal steadily and aims for it unswervingly. That is dedication.
author: Cecil B. DeMille

content: Music in the soul can be heard by the universe.
author: Laozi

content: If one way be better than another, that you may be sure is nature's way.
author: Aristotle

content: Most of the shadows of life are caused by standing in our own sunshine.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: As you walk in God's divine wisdom, you will surely begin to see a greater measure of victory and good success in your life.
author: Joseph Prince

content: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
author: Socrates

content: One fails forward toward success.
author: Charles F. Kettering

content: First we thought the PC was a calculator. Then we found out how to turn numbers into letters with ASCII — and we thought it was a typewriter. Then we discovered graphics, and we thought it was a television. With the World Wide Web, we've realized it's a brochure.
author: Douglas Adams

content: Business, you know, may bring you money, but friendship hardly ever does.
author: Jane Austen

content: Some of the best lessons we ever learn are learned from past mistakes. The error of the past is the wisdom and success of the future.
author: Dale Turner

content: Wisdom ceases to be wisdom when it becomes too proud to weep, too grave to laugh, and too selfish to seek other than itself.
author: Kahlil Gibran

content: A man must be big enough to admit his mistakes, smart enough to profit from them, and strong enough to correct them.
author: John C. Maxwell

content: We should not give up and we should not allow the problem to defeat us.
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

content: Rejoicing in our joy, not suffering over our suffering, makes someone a friend.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Alan Watts
content: I have realized that the past and future are real illusions, that they exist in the present, which is what there is and all there is.

author: Winston Churchill
content: Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.

author: Casey Stengel
content: Finding good players is easy. Getting them to play as a team is another story.
Good advice is always certain to be ignored, but that's no reason not to give it.
author: Agatha Christie

content: Friendship is held to be the severest test of character. It is easy, we think, to be loyal to a family and clan, whose blood is in your own veins.
author: Charles Eastman

content: The rule of friendship means there should be mutual sympathy between them, each supplying what the other lacks and trying to benefit the other, always using friendly and sincere words.
author: Cicero

content: Don't smother each other. No one can grow in the shade.
author: Leo Buscaglia

content: Be slow of tongue and quick of eye.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

content: Quality means doing it right when no one is looking.
author: Henry Ford

content: Love is like a friendship caught on fire. In the beginning a flame, very pretty, often hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. As love grows older, our hearts mature and our love becomes as coals, deep-burning and unquenchable.
author: Bruce Lee

content: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.
author: Buddha

content: Take time to deliberate, but when the time for action has arrived, stop thinking and go in.
author: Napoleon

content: You cannot travel the path until you have become the path itself.
author: Buddha

content: If you wish to be a writer, write.
author: Epictetus

content: America's freedom of religion, and freedom from religion, offers every wisdom tradition an opportunity to address our soul-deep needs: Christianity, Judaism, Islam, Buddhism, Hinduism, secular humanism, agnosticism and atheism among others.
author: Parker Palmer

content: Never mistake activity for achievement.
author: John Wooden

content: Today you are you! That is truer than true! There is no one alive who is you-er than you!
author: Dr. Seuss

content: All this modern technology just makes people try to do everything at once.
author: Bill Watterson
Billie Jean King
content: Champions keep playing until they get it right.
If you have the guts to keep making mistakes, your wisdom and intelligence leap forward with huge momentum.
author: Holly Near
Ian Botham
content: To me, it doesn't matter how good you are. Sport is all about playing and competing. Whatever you do in cricket and in sport, enjoy it, be positive and try to win.
Either you run the day or the day runs you.
author: Jim Rohn

content: The more sand that has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

content: Edison failed 10,000 times before he made the electric light. Do not be discouraged if you fail a few times.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: No man was ever wise by chance.
author: Seneca the Younger

content: Swim upstream. Go the other way. Ignore the conventional wisdom.
author: Sam Walton
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
content: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.
It is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: A prudent question is one half of wisdom.
author: Francis Bacon

content: Fear not for the future, weep not for the past.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

content: Always be yourself, express yourself, have faith in yourself, do not go out and look for a successful personality and duplicate it.
author: Bruce Lee

content: All is flux; nothing stays still.
author: Heraclitus

content: They say that time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.
author: Andy Warhol
Winston Churchill
content: I am an optimist. It does not seem too much use being anything else.
Our character is what we do when we think no one is looking.
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.
George S. Patton
content: A good plan violently executed now is better than a perfect plan executed next week.
If we could see the miracle of a single flower clearly, our whole life would change.
author: Buddha

content: What wisdom can you find that is greater than kindness?
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

content: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.
author: William Shakespeare

content: Love, friendship and respect do not unite people as much as a common hatred for something.
author: Anton Chekhov

content: Honesty is the best policy.
author: Benjamin Franklin

content: Two of man's basic needs are to love and to share. Both of these needs are satisfied in greater or lesser degree by friendship.
author: Mother Angelica

content: Conflict is the gadfly of thought. It stirs us to observation and memory. It instigates to invention. It shocks us out of sheeplike passivity, and sets us at noting and contriving.
author: John Dewey

content: Respect should be earned by actions, and not acquired by years.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

content: Wise men talk because they have something to say; fools, because they have to say something.
author: Plato

content: A long habit of not thinking a thing wrong gives it a superficial appearance of being right.
author: Thomas Paine

content: It is one of the severest tests of friendship to tell your friend his faults. So to love a man that you cannot bear to see a stain upon him, and to speak painful truth through loving words, that is friendship.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

content: Positive thinking will let you do everything better than negative thinking will.
author: Zig Ziglar

content: There is no retirement for an artist, it's your way of living so there is no end to it.
author: Henry Moore

content: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

content: Constant kindness can accomplish much. As the sun makes ice melt, kindness causes misunderstanding, mistrust, and hostility to evaporate.
author: Albert Schweitzer

content: Everyone in the world ought to do the things for which he is specially adapted. It is the part of wisdom to recognize what each one of us is best fitted for, and it is the part of education to perfect and utilize such predispositions. Because education can direct and aid nature but can never transform her.
author: Maria Montessori

content: The greatest achievement of humanity is not its works of art, science, or technology, but the recognition of its own dysfunction.
author: Eckhart Tolle

content: To fly as fast as thought, you must begin by knowing that you have already arrived.
author: Richard Bach

content: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.
author: E. E. Cummings

content: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: The more you care, the stronger you can be.
author: Jim Rohn

content: Set your goals high, and don't stop till you get there.
author: Bo Jackson

content: What matters is the value we've created in our lives, the people we've made happy and how much we've grown as people.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

content: True friendship is a plant of slow growth, and must undergo and withstand the shocks of adversity, before it is entitled to the appellation.
author: George Washington

content: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.
author: Elie Wiesel
W. Clement Stone
content: Aim for the moon. If you miss, you may hit a star.
The right way is not always the popular and easy way. Standing for right when it is unpopular is a true test of moral character.
author: Margaret Chase Smith

content: Life is a succession of lessons, which must be lived to be understood.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Adversity causes some men to break, others to break records.
author: William Arthur Ward

content: He is able who thinks he is able.
author: Buddha

content: Friends are the siblings God never gave us.
author: Mencius

content: Truth is generally the best vindication against slander.
author: Abraham Lincoln
Yogi Berra
content: Half the lies they tell about me aren't true.
An idea that is developed and put into action is more important than an idea that exists only as an idea.
author: Buddha

content: The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only a page.
author: Augustine of Hippo

content: I have never been hurt by anything I didn't say.
author: Calvin Coolidge

content: Cunning... is but the low mimic of wisdom.
author: Plato

content: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed people can change the world. Indeed. It is the only thing that ever has.
author: Margaret Mead

content: I would maintain that thanks are the highest form of thought, and that gratitude is happiness doubled by wonder.
author: G. K. Chesterton

content: Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows.
author: Buddha

content: Never bend your head. Always hold it high. Look the world right in the eye.
author: Helen Keller

content: A house divided against itself cannot stand.
author: Abraham Lincoln

content: The more light you allow within you, the brighter the world you live in will be.
author: Shakti Gawain

content: Happiness comes when your work and words are of benefit to yourself and others.
author: Buddha

content: Of course there is no formula for success except perhaps an unconditional acceptance of life and what it brings.
author: Arthur Rubinstein

content: Sooner or later, those who win are those who think they can.
author: Richard Bach

content: If you are bitter, you are like a dry leaf that you can just squash, and you can get blown away by the wind. There is much more wisdom in forgiveness.
author: Vusi Mahlasela

content: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

content: All our knowledge begins with the senses, proceeds then to the understanding, and ends with reason. There is nothing higher than reason.
author: Immanuel Kant
Alan Watts
content: But I'll tell you what hermits realize. If you go off into a far, far forest and get very quiet, you'll come to understand that you're connected with everything.
There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness, thinking of others first; when you learn to live for others, they will live for you.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

content: Here is one quality that one must possess to win, and that is definiteness of purpose, the knowledge of what one wants, and a burning desire to possess it.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: There is no duty we so underrate as the duty of being happy. By being happy we sow anonymous benefits upon the world.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

content: There are many ways of going forward, but only one way of standing still.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
Kyle Chandler
content: Opportunity does not knock, it presents itself when you beat down the door.
Wisdom is always an overmatch for strength.
author: Phil Jackson

content: Do not be too timid and squeamish about your reactions. All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: You cannot be lonely if you like the person you're alone with.
author: Wayne Dyer

content: Wrinkles should merely indicate where smiles have been.
author: Mark Twain

content: Look up at the stars and not down at your feet. Try to make sense of what you see, and wonder about what makes the universe exist. Be curious.
author: Stephen Hawking

content: No person is your friend who demands your silence or denies your right to grow.
author: Alice Walker

content: Friendship is but another name for an alliance with the follies and the misfortunes of others. Our own share of miseries is sufficient: why enter then as volunteers into those of another?
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: If you have knowledge, let others light their candles in it.
author: Margaret Fuller

content: A man is great by deeds, not by birth.
author: Chanakya

content: All fixed set patterns are incapable of adaptability or pliability. The truth is outside of all fixed patterns.
author: Bruce Lee

content: That's the risk you take if you change: that people you've been involved with won't like the new you. But other people who do will come along.
author: Lisa Alther

content: Remembering a wrong is like carrying a burden on the mind.
author: Buddha

content: All that we are is the result of what we have thought. The mind is everything. What we think we become.
author: Buddha

content: Promises are the uniquely human way of ordering the future, making it predictable and reliable to the extent that this is humanly possible.
author: Hannah Arendt

content: Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love.
author: Francis of Assisi
Benjamin Disraeli
content: Never complain and never explain.
I define friendship as a bond that transcends all barriers. When you are ready to expect anything and everything from friends, good, bad or ugly... that's what I call true friendship.
author: Harbhajan Singh

content: Every gift from a friend is a wish for your happiness.
author: Richard Bach
Muhammad Ali
content: It's just a job. Grass grows, birds fly, waves pound the sand. I beat people up.
Never accept ultimatums, conventional wisdom, or absolutes.
author: Christopher Reeve

content: So is cheerfulness, or a good temper, the more it is spent, the more remains.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: What we think, we become.
author: Buddha

content: Before you put on a frown, make absolutely sure there are no smiles available.
author: James M. Beggs

content: We cannot do everything at once, but we can do something at once.
author: Calvin Coolidge

content: Yesterday I dared to struggle. Today I dare to win.
author: Bernadette Devlin

content: A true friend freely, advises justly, assists readily, adventures boldly, takes all patiently, defends courageously, and continues a friend unchangeably.
author: William C. Menninger

content: Setting an example is not the main means of influencing another, it is the only means.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Most powerful is he who has himself in his own power.
author: Seneca the Younger

content: All things must come to the soul from its roots, from where it is planted.
author: Teresa of Ávila

content: Short words are best and the old words when short are best of all.
author: Winston Churchill

content: Do not wait; the time will never be 'just right.' Start where you stand, and work with whatever tools you may have at your command, and better tools will be found as you go along.
author: George Herbert

content: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.
author: Oprah Winfrey

content: If I know what love is, it is because of you.
author: Hermann Hesse

content: Happiness is found in doing, not merely possessing.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: Work for something because it is good, not just because it stands a chance to succeed.
author: Václav Havel

content: You cannot find yourself by going into the past. You can find yourself by coming into the present.
author: Eckhart Tolle

content: We never understand how little we need in this world until we know the loss of it.
author: J. M. Barrie

content: He who experiences the unity of life sees his own Self in all beings, and all beings in his own Self, and looks on everything with an impartial eye.
author: Buddha
Confucius
content: The superior man understands what is right; the inferior man understands what will sell.
Ignorance never settles a question.
author: Benjamin Disraeli
Vince Lombardi
content: Winners never quit and quitters never win.
Difficulties are meant to rouse, not discourage. The human spirit is to grow strong by conflict.
author: William Ellery Channing

content: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
author: Isaac Asimov
H. G. Wells
content: If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.
Friendship without self-interest is one of the rare and beautiful things of life.
author: James F. Byrnes

content: Character is like a tree and reputation like a shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.
author: Abraham Lincoln

content: All of our technology is completely unnecessary to a happy life.
author: Tom Hodgkinson

content: I do not believe in a fate that falls on men however they act; but I do believe in a fate that falls on man unless they act.
author: G. K. Chesterton

content: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

content: Anybody can make history. Only a great man can write it.
author: Oscar Wilde
Alan Watts
content: The ego is nothing other than the focus of conscious attention.
You have to do your own growing no matter how tall your grandfather was.
author: Abraham Lincoln

content: Numberless are the worlds wonders, but none more wonderful than man.
author: Sophocles

content: Maxim for life: You get treated in life the way you teach people to treat you.
author: Wayne Dyer

content: First comes thought; then organization of that thought, into ideas and plans; then transformation of those plans into reality. The beginning, as you will observe, is in your imagination.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: We are Divine enough to ask and we are important enough to receive.
author: Wayne Dyer
Alan Watts
content: You and I are all as much continuous with the physical universe as a wave is continuous with the ocean.
Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.
author: Richard Bach

content: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers. It may not be difficult to store up in the mind a vast quantity of facts within a comparatively short time, but the ability to form judgments requires the severe discipline of hard work and the tempering heat of experience and maturity.
author: Calvin Coolidge

content: Read as you taste fruit or savor wine, or enjoy friendship, love or life.
author: George Herbert

content: Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you'd have preferred to talk.
author: Doug Larson

content: If you smile when no one else is around, you really mean it.
author: Andy Rooney

content: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you.
author: Laozi

content: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
author: Immanuel Kant

content: Never promise more than you can perform.
author: Publilius Syrus

content: Learning never exhausts the mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

content: Without this playing with fantasy no creative work has ever yet come to birth. The debt we owe to the play of the imagination is incalculable.
author: Carl Jung

content: You really can change the world if you care enough.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

content: If you lose today, win tomorrow. In this never-ending spirit of challenge is the heart of a victor.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

content: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path.
author: Buddha

content: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
author: Laozi

content: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: Genius unrefined resembles a flash of lightning, but wisdom is like the sun.
author: Franz Grillparzer

content: If you don't go after what you want, you'll never have it. If you don't ask, the answer is always no. If you don't step forward, you're always in the same place.
author: Nora Roberts

content: A man may fulfil the object of his existence by asking a question he cannot answer and attempting a task he cannot achieve.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

content: The young man knows the rules, but the old man knows the exceptions.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

content: The years teach much which the days never know.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: To study and not think is a waste. To think and not study is dangerous.
author: Confucius

content: One that desires to excel should endeavor in those things that are in themselves most excellent.
author: Epictetus

content: Reviewing what you have learned and learning anew, you are fit to be a teacher.
author: Confucius

content: Intuition is the very force or activity of the soul in its experience through whatever has been the experience of the soul itself.
author: Henry Reed

content: Friendship increases in visiting friends, but in visiting them seldom.
author: Francis Bacon

content: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: False friendship, like the ivy, decays and ruins the walls it embraces; but true friendship gives new life and animation to the object it supports.
author: Richard Burton

content: Our intention creates our reality.
author: Wayne Dyer

content: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
author: Mother Teresa
Woody Allen
content: Interestingly, according to modern astronomers, space is finite. This is a very comforting thought-- particularly for people who can never remember where they have left things.
There are only two mistakes one can make along the road to truth; not going all the way, and not starting.
author: Buddha

content: The winds and waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.
author: Edward Gibbon

content: He who knows others is wise. He who knows himself is enlightened.
author: Laozi

content: I believe that we are fundamentally the same and have the same basic potential.
author: Dalai Lama

content: The aim of life is self-development. To realize one's nature perfectly - that is what each of us is here for.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: Yeah, we all shine on, like the moon, and the stars, and the sun.
author: John Lennon

content: Speak low, if you speak love.
author: William Shakespeare

content: We can do no great things, only small things with great love.
author: Mother Teresa

content: Look back over the past, with its changing empires that rose and fell, and you can foresee the future, too.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: You can only grow if you're willing to feel awkward and uncomfortable when you try something new.
author: Brian Tracy

content: Habit, if not resisted, soon becomes necessity.
author: Augustine of Hippo

content: The cautious seldom err.
author: Confucius

content: I'd rather attempt to do something great and fail than to attempt to do nothing and succeed.
author: Robert Schuller

content: Happiness cannot be travelled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed. Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace and gratitude.
author: Denis Waitley

content: Just as treasures are uncovered from the earth, so virtue appears from good deeds, and wisdom appears from a pure and peaceful mind. To walk safely through the maze of human life, one needs the light of wisdom and the guidance of virtue.
author: Buddha

content: This is the final test of a gentleman: his respect for those who can be of no possible value to him.
author: William Lyon Phelps

content: Things turn out best for those who make the best of the way things turn out.
author: Jack Buck

content: Whoso loves, believes the impossible.
author: Elizabeth Browning

content: Joy is the best makeup.
author: Anne Lamott

content: Great indeed is the sublimity of the Creative, to which all beings owe their beginning, and which permeates all heaven.
author: Laozi

content: Friendship needs no words - it is solitude delivered from the anguish of loneliness.
author: Dag Hammarskjöld

content: Happiness is not in the mere possession of money; it lies in the joy of achievement, in the thrill of creative effort.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

content: Friendship is essentially a partnership.
author: Aristotle
Dan Gable
content: Gold medals aren't really made of gold. They're made of sweat, determination, and a hard-to-find alloy called guts.
Anyone who doesn't take truth seriously in small matters cannot be trusted in large ones either.
author: Albert Einstein

content: He is no fool who gives what he cannot keep to gain what he cannot lose.
author: Jim Elliot

content: The least of things with a meaning is worth more in life than the greatest of things without it.
author: Carl Jung

content: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
author: Pablo Picasso

content: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: Friendship multiplies the good of life and divides the evil.
author: Baltasar Gracián

content: May our hearts garden of awakening bloom with hundreds of flowers.
author: Thích Nhất Hạnh

content: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: People don't notice whether it's winter or summer when they're happy.
author: Anton Chekhov

content: We are stuck with technology when what we really want is just stuff that works.
author: Douglas Adams

content: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
author: Epictetus

content: I am a man of fixed and unbending principles, the first of which is to be flexible at all times.
author: Everett Dirksen

content: The smallest flower is a thought, a life answering to some feature of the Great Whole, of whom they have a persistent intuition.
author: Honoré de Balzac

content: Sometimes being a friend means mastering the art of timing. There is a time for silence. A time to let go and allow people to hurl themselves into their own destiny. And a time to prepare to pick up the pieces when it's all over.
author: Octavia E. Butler
Amelia Earhart
content: The most effective way to do it, is to do it.
Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Confucius

content: Cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides

content: You can stand tall without standing on someone. You can be a victor without having victims.
author: Harriet Woods

content: You were not born a winner, and you were not born a loser. You are what you make yourself be.
author: Lou Holtz

content: I care not so much what I am to others as what I am to myself. I will be rich by myself, and not by borrowing.
author: Michel de Montaigne

content: If facts are the seeds that later produce knowledge and wisdom, then the emotions and the impressions of the senses are the fertile soil in which the seeds must grow.
author: Rachel Carson
Harriet Beecher Stowe
content: Never give up, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
Think in the morning. Act in the noon. Eat in the evening. Sleep in the night.
author: William Blake

content: But friendship is precious, not only in the shade, but in the sunshine of life, and thanks to a benevolent arrangement the greater part of life is sunshine.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: Know how to listen, and you will profit even from those who talk badly.
author: Plutarch

content: He who knows that enough is enough will always have enough.
author: Laozi

content: Life is a progress, and not a station.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: A friend to all is a friend to none.
author: Aristotle

content: The mind unlearns with difficulty what it has long learned.
author: Seneca the Younger
Winston Churchill
content: The truth is incontrovertible. Malice may attack it, ignorance may deride it, but in the end, there it is.

author: Jack Welch
content: An organization's ability to learn, and translate that learning into action rapidly, is the ultimate competitive advantage.
We all live with the objective of being happy; our lives are all different and yet the same.
author: Anne Frank

content: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving.
author: Albert Einstein

content: By letting it go it all gets done. The world is won by those who let it go. But when you try and try. The world is beyond the winning.
author: Laozi

content: Everything that exists is in a manner the seed of that which will be.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Love cures people - both the ones who give it and the ones who receive it.
author: Karl Menninger

content: He who wishes to secure the good of others, has already secured his own.
author: Confucius

content: In dwelling, live close to the ground. In thinking, keep to the simple. In conflict, be fair and generous. In governing, don't try to control. In work, do what you enjoy. In family life, be completely present.
author: Laozi
Woody Allen
content: How is it possible to find meaning in a finite world, given my waist and shirt size?
Judge nothing, you will be happy. Forgive everything, you will be happier. Love everything, you will be happiest.
author: Sri Chinmoy

content: I'd rather regret the things that I have done than the things that I have not done.
author: Lucille Ball

content: Without passion man is a mere latent force and possibility, like the flint which awaits the shock of the iron before it can give forth its spark.
author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel

content: If you'll not settle for anything less than your best, you will be amazed at what you can accomplish in your lives.
author: Vince Lombardi

content: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.
author: Basil of Caesarea

content: In rivers, the water that you touch is the last of what has passed and the first of that which comes; so with present time.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

content: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Learning is the beginning of wealth. Learning is the beginning of health. Learning is the beginning of spirituality. Searching and learning is where the miracle process all begins.
author: Jim Rohn

content: We are made wise not by the recollection of our past, but by the responsibility for our future.
author: Bernard Shaw

content: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

content: No distance of place or lapse of time can lessen the friendship of those who are thoroughly persuaded of each other's worth.
author: Robert Southey

content: Mistakes are the usual bridge between inexperience and wisdom.
author: Phyllis Grissim-Theroux

content: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Let your hook always be cast; in the pool where you least expect it, there will be a fish.
author: Ovid

content: Love does not consist of gazing at each other, but in looking together in the same direction.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

content: It has long been an axiom of mine that the little things are infinitely the most important.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

content: My friends are my estate.
author: Emily Dickinson

content: Always keep your mind as bright and clear as the vast sky, the great ocean, and the highest peak, empty of all thoughts. Always keep your body filled with light and heat. Fill yourself with the power of wisdom and enlightenment.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

content: Never apologize for showing feelings. When you do so, you apologize for the truth.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

content: Technology… is a queer thing. It brings you great gifts with one hand, and it stabs you in the back with the other.
author: Carrie Snow

content: If you look into your own heart, and you find nothing wrong there, what is there to worry about? What is there to fear?
author: Confucius

content: Happiness can exist only in acceptance.
author: George Orwell

content: No yesterdays are ever wasted for those who give themselves to today.
author: Brendan Behan
Henry David Thoreau
content: Many men go fishing all of their lives without knowing that it is not fish they are after.
It is only when the mind and character slumber that the dress can be seen.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Keep silence for the most part, and speak only when you must, and then briefly.
author: Epictetus

content: Everything in the universe goes by indirection. There are no straight lines.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Fortune befriends the bold.
author: John Dryden

content: If you talk to a man in a language he understands, that goes to his head. If you talk to him in his language, that goes to his heart.
author: Nelson Mandela

content: Men in general judge more from appearances than from reality. All men have eyes, but few have the gift of penetration.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

content: The free man is he who does not fear to go to the end of his thought.
author: Léon Blum

content: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
author: Og Mandino

content: Peace begins with a smile.
author: Mother Teresa

content: Rock n' roll as a genre is different from pop and hip hop: it is about bands, and that for me suggests brotherhood, family, friendship and community.
author: Steven Van Zandt

content: Freedom is not worth having if it does not connote freedom to err.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: He who fears being conquered is sure of defeat.
author: Napoleon

content: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Nothing is at last sacred but the integrity of your own mind.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: The problem with Google is you have 360 degrees of omnidirectional information on a linear basis, but the algorithms for irony and ambiguity are not there. And those are the algorithms of wisdom.
author: William Hurt

content: An invincible determination can accomplish almost anything and in this lies the great distinction between great men and little men.
author: Thomas Fuller

content: When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world.
author: John Muir
